entry: TODO:Black Reliquary will be a drastically different experience from what you are used to. Abandon what you think you know. The majority of mechanics have been overhauled or re-tuned, as well as dramatic alterations to some heroes. What has most certainly remained the same is that when your heroes die, they stay dead.

TODO:The challenges you face now will ask a lot of you. Your skill, adaptation, and powers of observation will be put to the test. You will know little mercy, but will taste well-earned triumphs in these new lands.
TODO:All-too-familiar faces will mingle with new acquaintances in your new home as you launch your campaign of valor, fortune, and redemption against the emerging darkness of the...
TODO:Be sure to check out our Discord and Twitter for more mod updates! Unfortunately, we can't get rid of this pop-up, or even make it link to our socials properly.
TODO:This pop-up was meant to ask about data collection required for The Butcher’s Circus DLC. We can't get rid of this pop-up, but Butcher's Circus is not accessible in Black Reliquary.
Cliquez sur la lettre pour démarrer
TODO:Reliquary campaigns are the "original" settings for the game. For those familiar with Darkest Dungeon, this will test your skills.
Faites glisser les mods pour établir l'ordre de priorité. Le haut de la liste a la plus haute priorité.
TODO:Your version of Black Reliquary is now up to date

TODO:The Kvarotz upper ruins are sunken into the sands. Determine what can be navigated.
TODO:Scour the ruins in the sands for anything which can be of use to us.
TODO:The Wildlanders residing in the ravaged remains of the Kvarotz buildings may yet have things we can find useful.
TODO:The Kvarotz upper ruins are sunken into the sands. Determine what can be navigated.
TODO:Scour the ruins in the sands for anything which can be of use to us.
TODO:The Wildlanders residing in the ravaged remains of the Kvarotz buildings may yet have things we can find useful.
TODO:Kvarotz technology and Levantine supplies are abundant here. Bring back what you can.
TODO:Vital resources are bountiful deep within the dust-coated Kvarotz remains.
TODO:We need charts of the Catacombs to better scavenge supplies from it.
TODO:There is no place more ripe with Amber than these infested tunnels.
TODO:Navigate the labyrinth of tunnels for supplies, and exterminate some pests while you're at it.
TODO:Scour these caverns for materials and chart your route for future excursions.
TODO:Vast wealth awaits us in the Treasury, but it is not free for the taking.
TODO:Every chart of the Treasury makes looting its riches a little bit easier.
TODO:Reveal the traps and caches, and we will harvest the fruits of your efforts.
TODO:The Wildlanders do not belong in the valley. We must make a demonstration of them and rebuke their clans from these lands.
TODO:If the Wildlanders seek might and power, we will show it to them.
TODO:The exposed Kvarotz ruins are too inhabited for us to plunder. It is time to rectify this problem.
TODO:The Wildlanders do not belong in the valley. We must make a demonstration of them and rebuke their clans from these lands.
TODO:If the Wildlanders seek might and power, we will show it to them.
TODO:The exposed Kvarotz ruins are too inhabited for us to plunder. It is time to rectify this problem.
TODO:The Levantine encampments will only spread if we do not stem the tide.
TODO:Intercept the Levantine scouts before they can return to their commanders. We must slow their progress.
TODO:Establish control over more segments of the Catacombs. Every inch we claim pushes back the Levantine.
TODO:The Troglodytes should not be left to their own devices. Disrupt their sinister machinations.
TODO:The Troglodytes spawn in overwhelming numbers. We must once again prune their horde.
TODO:A terrible evil is forming deep within the cavernous maze. We shall hinder it in the most direct way possible.
TODO:It is time to reap the rewards of our scouting efforts.
TODO:We return to the halls of wealth, now to collect what we have earned.
TODO:Small hoards of riches have been located and charted. We need only to seize them.

TODO:We venture into the valley for the first time. The catacombs of the Kvarotz are a dangerous place in their own right, but the Levantine have made it their new dig site.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s retreated from our very first endeavor. This does not bode well.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s have become familiar with the valley. This is only the beginning.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s were the first to Enter the Catacombs
TODO:The ancient Kvarotz mechanisms still skulk in the shadows.
TODO:The Levantine have come to pilfer the vast necropolis of the Kvarotz.
TODO:Levantine soldiers are organized and disciplined, taking advantage of tactical opportunities.
TODO:Treasure is not found in darkness, but rather because of it.
TODO:Rusted Kvarotz electrum can be revitalized when oiled.
TODO:The sinister technology and knowledge of the Kvarotz contain dangerous powers.
TODO:The Levantine take advantage of the chance to brace for combat, as should you.
TODO:Vendors ask for specific relics or special items to exchange
TODO:One of the Vizier's most talented Janissaries stands tall and proud in his camp, boldly displaying his location to us and boasting that he will give us an honorable defeat.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s could not stand to the Janissary's might. His challenge remains as an open invitation.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s have honorably defeated the Janissary, and claimed his relic.
TODO:The Janissary insists upon one-on-one duels.
TODO:The Janissary may call upon his forces to battle the heroes he's not dueling.
TODO:Agile and versatile, the Janissary does not make himself an easy target.

TODO:A leader of the Levantine has revealed her location to us and desires to defeat us herself. This open challenge will embolden her forces the longer it remains unanswered; extinguishing her now would prove most advantageous.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s were unable to defeat the Enchantress leader this day. We must be ready to strike again.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s have slain the Levantine Enchantress, and furthered our campaign.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s went to fight the Levantine Enchantress.
TODO:The Enchantress prefers to strike from a distance.
TODO:Your heroes most vulnerable to toxins will be in great peril.
TODO:A great many serpents will arise to defend the Enchantress.
TODO:Massive serpents can strike from unseen places.
TODO:One of the Matrons has made her camp known to us, directly challenging our mettle. Failure here would invariably rally her forces. Put an end to her iron-fisted reign.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s failed to stand up to the Warhawk Matron. Her clan's laughs echo through the dunes.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s preyed upon the Warhawk. Her followers are left rattled, and our control expands.
TODO:The Warhawk's various munitions carry unique properties.
TODO:The Warhawk may call upon her followers to liven up the fight.
TODO:The Warhawk's attacks are diverse and can cover your team rather well.
TODO:The Warhawk needs time to load her munitions.
TODO:Another matron cries out for battle, signaling herself to us from the sunken ruins below. Quell this warrior and we will diminish their morale in turn.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s were too weak for the Steelpath Matron. The bloodlust of her clan grows ever more fervent.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s vanquished the Steelpath Matron. The Wildlanders' grip continues to weaken.
TODO:The Steelpath Matron thrives against bleeding opponents.
TODO:The Steelpath's pack of hyenas are equally as bloodthirsty as the Matron.
TODO:Expect your heroes to bleed heavily.
TODO:The Steelpath Matron's crazed bloodlust is not sustainable and can exhaust her.
TODO:The Troglodytes have grown a monstrosity. With each passing day, it feasts and grows. Destroy the damned thing before it gets any larger.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s could not quell the Gastrosaur's rampage.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s delved down to the Gastrosaur.
TODO:The Gastrosaur becomes more violent as its health diminishes.
TODO:The hide of the Gastrosaur is resilient. Honing Oil may be of use.
TODO:Supplies to cure and resist bleed and blight may be vital.
TODO:Our path deeper into Troglodyte territory is impeded by an unfathomable threat. It will take unconventional methods to achieve victory...
TODO:{?hero_names}%s could not face the Greater Wurm.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s stood against the Greater Wurm.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s set out to face the Greater Wurm.
TODO:The Flameseeker will provide cannon fire when the moment is right.
TODO:The Wurm's hide is far too durable to attack directly.
TODO:Every beast no matter how large has a weak spot. It may just need to be {colour_start|mark}revealed.{colour_end}
TODO:Your heroes will not be able to deal fatal damage to the Wurm by themselves.
TODO:A critical path is guarded by a Cactonid mass of an unnervingly pleasant appeal...
TODO:{?hero_names}%s could not resist the Alraune.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s embarked into the Alraune's grove.
TODO:The Alraune's suitors will only hold back once a hero is within their grasp.
TODO:Managing whoever is most suited to fight at the moment is key.
TODO:Flexible, balanced teams will be able to recover from the suitors' grasp.
TODO:Another node of the Cactonids is ripe to be plucked. Destroying this cluster of vines and roots is essential for us to reach the Reliquary.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s could not go through The Wall.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s toppled the wall and broke the Nucleic Growth.
TODO:The Core's wall will take whatever shape it needs to protect itself.
TODO:The wall will not survive without the Core.
TODO:The living wall takes different forms which behave in different ways.
TODO:A flexible team is ideal for the shape-shifting defenses of the Core.
TODO:We have found the Ghoul Mother at last. She has been looting our fallen heroes' possessions, hoarding them away in her filthy den. Let us reclaim what we have lost to this thief.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s were unsuccessful in their raid on the Ghoul Mother's den.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s returned with our possessions after dispatching the Ghoul Mother.
TODO:The Ghoul Mother will not hesitate to feast on her kin if it ensures her survival.
TODO:Be prepared to deal with the Ghoul Mother's deafening assaults on the mind and sanity.
TODO:If we tarry, the Ghoul Mother will flee with part of her hoard.

TODO:An excellent opportunity presents itself. Our scouts have located a hoard filled with our lost riches, scavenged by a singularly powerful Ghoul Mother. Rid us of this menace and reclaim what is ours.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s were unsuccessful in their raid on the Ghoul Mother's den.
TODO:{?hero_names}%s returned with our possessions after dispatching the Ghoul Mother.
TODO:The Ghoul Mother will not hesitate to feast on her kin if it ensures her survival.
TODO:Be prepared to deal with the Ghoul Mother's deafening assaults on the mind and sanity.
TODO:If we tarry, the Ghoul Mother will flee with part of her hoard.
TODO:The Ghoul Mother has scavenged %d lost trinkets! Clear out her den to reclaim them.
TODO:Smite the Ghoul Mother to recover %d of your lost trinkets.

TODO:When heroes {colour_start|notable}can't take the {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} any more{colour_end}, they can become {colour_start|harmful}AFFLICTED{colour_end}. This manifests in {colour_start|notable}different behaviors{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}stat changes{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}Afflictions{colour_end} last until you {colour_start|notable}send them to treatment{colour_end} on the Flameseeker, unless you can reduce their {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} to zero during the quest.

TODO:Your hero has a {colour_start|symptom}symptom{colour_end}! {colour_start|disease}Diseases{colour_end} begin with {colour_start|symptom}Symptoms{colour_end} which are more gentle than the fully contracted {colour_start|disease}Diseases{colour_end}. Disease kit provision items can be used to further treat these symptoms and diseases to lessen their effects, but they, barring few exceptions, can only be removed in the {colour_start|notable}Clinic{colour_end}.

TODO:Your hero is {colour_start|expiated}Expiated{colour_end}! New statuses are applied in combat from both friends and foes, such as {colour_start|amberblighted}Amberblight{colour_end}, {colour_start|expiated}Expiation{colour_end}, and {colour_start|enraged}Enraged{colour_end}. {colour_start|amberblighted}Amberblight{colour_end} applies an ongoing debuff to the target, {colour_start|expiated}Expiation{colour_end} damages the target whenever they attack and will end after triggering three times, dealing damage to target on its next three attacks and healing the opposite team after its next attack, and {colour_start|enraged}Enrage{colour_end} buffs the target, also providing them with health upon killing their enemies. Hover over the status icon an affected target for more information.

TODO:Camping consists of two parts: {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Skill phase{colour_end}. During the {colour_start|notable}Meal phase{colour_end}, you choose how much they eat, which determines recovery. Make sure you have enough food! {colour_start|notable}Skill Phase{colour_end} allows you to spend {colour_start|notable}Respite{colour_end} on different hero skills used for recuperation. Additionally, when camping under the {colour_start|sun_torch}sun{colour_end} of Exposed Interior, ambush prevention is not necessary.

TODO:Quest durations have been adjusted to be slightly longer, and now all missions include 1 more {colour_start|notable}firewood{colour_end} than before. Be sure to supply yourself in anticipation of more fights, blockages, and hunger. Short quests are strongly recommended for less experienced or prepared heroes.

TODO:Enemies and allies alike take advantage of a moment to brace themselves during the first round of combat. {colour_start|notable}Accuracy for ordinary attacks is halved and critical hits are impossible{colour_end}, however some abilities can ignore the Accuracy reduction of the {colour_start|notable}Prep Round{colour_end} and can be used for an initiating strike. Additionally, {colour_start|notable}certain hero skills have their effects altered during the Prep Round{colour_end}, so be sure to read over your heroes' skill descriptions.

TODO:The first of many heroes has given their all in service to you. You have the option of {colour_start|notable}retreating from combat{colour_end} and abandoning this quest to save the others, or {colour_start|notable}press onward{colour_end}. The choice is yours.
TODO:Discretion is the better part of valor...
TODO:A rarer iteration of Room Curios, Vendors accept only a specific type of item and offer up valuables in exchange.

TODO:In Black Reliquary, inventory has seen some changes to better integrate with the changes made to other systems. On top of two additional inventory slots, some items such as food, gold and gems had their stack size increased. Additionally, gems themselves are worth more than before. As for the loot changes, the Relics (previously heirlooms) are now obtained in much higher numbers in their specific dungeons, so make sure to pick your missions wisely.

TODO:When a hero is reduced to 0 HP, they are at {colour_start|harmful}Death's Door{colour_end}. Heroes start with the maximum amount of {colour_start|harmful}Deathblow{colour_end} Resist. While in this state, they will suffer {colour_start|notable}stat penalties{colour_end}, plus any further damage has a {colour_start|notable}chance to kill them{colour_end}. Successive attacks received on and attacks that bring heroes to {colour_start|harmful}Death's Door{colour_end} lower their {colour_start|harmful}Deathblow{colour_end} slightly for an extensive duration. {colour_start|notable}Heal{colour_end} them to get off {colour_start|deathdoor}Death's Door{colour_end}!

TODO:Scouted {colour_start|trap}traps{colour_end} will be {colour_start|notable}visible on the ground{colour_end} as you approach them. Select a hero and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} on the {colour_start|trap}trap{colour_end} to attempt to {colour_start|notable}disarm it{colour_end}. Some heroes are better than others at disarming, and Archaeology Kits can provide increased trap disarm chance when used.

TODO:Facilities in the {colour_start|notable}Amber Workshop{colour_end} generate resources while you are on a quest! Remember to put heroes to work weekly to keep up your resource gain. From there, clicking on the {colour_start|notable}[EMBARK]{colour_end} button at the bottom of the screen!

TODO:Hero panels now contain information about a class's various details which would be otherwise hidden in the {colour_start|notable}Hero Info{colour_end}. This shows information such as virtue chance, crit effects, riposte information, and more should that class have any other unique properties.

TODO:{colour_start|harmful}Stress{colour_end} continues to build beyond the point of {colour_start|harmful}Affliction{colour_end}. If a hero's stress bar fills a second time completely, their {colour_start|harmful}body will give out{colour_end}. Get them aid or retreat back to the Flameseeker before this happens. Death awaits us all.
Le corps atteint sa limite : Crise cardiaque

TODO:The display for the enemies' skills has been updated, and now in addition to showing more of the skills' effects, it also includes information about where and on what targets the skills can used on. In Info Comms, accessible via either the {colour_start|notable}[G]{colour_end} hotkey or the main menu, you can see the explanations on meaning for each of the icons. Just like before, a skill needs to be seen to show up on that panel.

TODO:Some monsters have high {colour_start|notable}PROT{colour_end}, which {colour_start|notable}absorbs attack damage{colour_end}. DOTs ({colour_start|pop_text_poison}blight{colour_end} and {colour_start|pop_text_bleed}bleed{colour_end}) ignore PROT and are effective means to take down these highly armored opponents. Additionally, the {colour_start|notable}Honing Oil{colour_end} supply is a good supplement to deal with those enemies for heroes that lack any other options.

TODO:{colour_start|notable}Positive quirks{colour_end} are now locked in by default, and will not be replaced. The {colour_start|notable}Clinic{colour_end} can be used to remove undesirable positive quirks for a small fee.

TODO:Some quirks develop as a result of successful attacks against factional enemies. This can result in both {colour_start|notable}positive{colour_end} and {colour_start|harmful}negative{colour_end} quirks based on the specific factions that are fought.
TODO:Heroes can only have {colour_start|notable}4 Camping skills active{colour_end} at a time. Toggle the skills on and off by clicking on them.

TODO:Most abilities on heroes have seen some adjustments made to their stats and designs. Some of these changes are minute, and some are significant. Several abilities have also been replaced entirely. Area of Effect abilities now have a {colour_start|notable}Negative Crit Multiplier{colour_end}: 2 Target AoEs: -40% CRT 3 Target AoEs: -60% CRT 4 Target AoEs: -70% CRT

TODO:Your heroes all carry different beliefs in their hearts. Some are devout to the {colour_start|affiliation_religious}Light{colour_end}, some worship the {colour_start|affiliation_pagan}pagan{colour_end} deities, and some {colour_start|affiliation_faithless}reject the gods entirely{colour_end}. Each type of affiliation has different advantages and disadvantages in combat, and while some heroes cannot fall into certain faiths, they can only be one of the three.

TODO:You have unlocked the ability to begin a new, more challenging campaign! When you create a new save file, you will be prompted if you wish to enable the 'NG+' ruleset. Be warned, in an NG+ campaign, monsters are tougher, they hit harder, and losing too many heroes or taking too many weeks will result in failure! The ferry awaits...

TODO:Over time, some {colour_start|harmful}negative quirks{colour_end} will lock into place and become {colour_start|notable}severe{colour_end}. Severe{colour_start|harmful} negative quirks{colour_end} cost much more to remove in the Clinic.

TODO:If you find yourself uncertain on aspects of Black Reliquary, try using the Help Menu (using {colour_start|notable}[H]{colour_end} as a hotkey). There are multiple Help Menus available in different places; The Flameseeker, each airship facility, the provision menu, dungeon rooms, dungeon hallways, and in the middle of combat.

TODO:After you've completed the requirements of a quest, you have the option to {colour_start|notable}return to the Flameseeker{colour_end} at any time - just {colour_start|notable}click the crest{colour_end}. You don't need to return to the starting room of the dungeon to exit.

TODO:Heroes who have returned from a successful quest in the Darkest Dungeon have seen too much. Depending on which game mode and game options you have selected, they may choose to never go back, or simply will be stressed upon re-entry.

TODO:Each quest has {colour_start|notable}different goals and rewards{colour_end}, and each region has its own challenges. Experiment with various combinations to see what works! However, it's recommended to bring along a {colour_start|notable}Vestal{colour_end} or an {colour_start|notable}Occultist{colour_end} for healing.

TODO:Heroes gain {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} for each successful quest. {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} determines the hero's {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end}. {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} gain and requirements have been adjusted to smooth out the progression curve for the course of Black Reliquary's campaign.

TODO:A critical scouting success will sometimes reveal a {colour_start|notable}Perfumer's Outpost{colour_end}! Advance to the marked tile, and press 'W' or click to enter. The mysterious Perfumer conducts his clandestine experiments in numerous locations around the valley. He is known to offer up strange and intriguing objects, asking people to return to him after observing their power.
TODO:You can sell back unwanted trinkets from your Trinket Inventory and make some money. Open the Trinket Inventory and [SHIFT-CLICK] on any trinket you don't want.

TODO:The ferry {colour_start|notable}allows you to recruit new heroes{colour_end}. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a hero's icon to view their information. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Drag and drop]{colour_end} them into your roster.
TODO:The Ferry is Your Hero Lifeblood

TODO:While you're here, spend some of your starting relics on {colour_start|notable}upgrading the Ferry's Sails and Cabins{colour_end}. This will increase the number of heroes available here in the future. To upgrade click the {colour_start|notable}[+]{colour_end} symbol on the left, and then click the upgrade.

TODO:Many actions and experiences cause {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end}. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} damage appears above heroes' heads, in black type. {colour_start|harmful}{colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end}{colour_end} can also be {colour_start|notable}healed{colour_end}, and that appears in white type.

TODO:There are many ways for heroes to spend their time on the Flameseeker. Heroes can relieve {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by taking part in activities at the {colour_start|notable}Galley{colour_end}. Or they can produce and interact with {colour_start|BR_heirloom}Refined Amber Dust{colour_end} in the {colour_start|notable}Amber Workshop{colour_end}. Both the {colour_start|notable}Amber Refinery{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}Tek Exchange{colour_end} in the {colour_start|notable}Amber Workshop{colour_end} heal a very small amount of stress and {colour_start|notable}do not remove afflictions{colour_end}. Commiting a hero to an activity {colour_start|notable}locks them in that activity{colour_end} until the {colour_start|notable}next Week{colour_end}. You'll have to take a different hero with you on your next quest.

TODO:You'll want to take {colour_start|notable}different supplies{colour_end} depending on what {colour_start|notable}region{colour_end} you are going to, how {colour_start|notable}long{colour_end} the quest is, and your own preferences. But always bring some {colour_start|notable}food{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}torches{colour_end}! For your first short quest, try bringing at least 8 food and 4 torches.

TODO:The {colour_start|notable}light{colour_end} is fading! The current {colour_start|notable}torch level affects which enemies you may run into{colour_end}. The darker it gets, the more likely it is to run into challenging enemies which offer up greater rewards for defeating. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT-CLICK]{colour_end} on a torch from inventory to boost the light back up. Likewise, certain enemies will also only appear in bright light, although they do not give more loot.

TODO:Each hero has room to equip two items, called {colour_start|notable}trinkets{colour_end}. Just {colour_start|notable}drag the trinket{colour_end} from inventory over to the {colour_start|notable}selected hero's slot{colour_end}. {colour_start|notable}Trinkets{colour_end} generally have a trade-off: something good, something bad. Some are also class-specific.

TODO:To enter a {colour_start|notable}door{colour_end}, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CLICK]{colour_end} or press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[W]{colour_end} when standing in front of it.

TODO:Sometimes, heroes respond to the onslaught of {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} by becoming {colour_start|notable}VIRTUOUS{colour_end}! This elevated state of performance will last until they suffer a large amount of stress or return to the Flameseeker, and confers {colour_start|notable}stat bonuses{colour_end} and other benefits.

TODO:The Perfumer asks that you {colour_start|notable}bring his trinkets back to him{colour_end} at a later time so that he may gather more materials and apply experimental enhancements to them. Please note that this interaction only works if the trinket is dragged from the player's provision inventory. If the trinket is equipped, you must put it there before interacting. (Trinket interactions may appear invalid, but they still function as normal)

TODO:{colour_start|cursed_gem}Malignant Vestiges{colour_end} are a unique type of loot dropped exclusively from Cactonid enemies. These exceedingly valuable treasures bring various penalties while in your inventory, so consider the effects carefully! These effects do not stack. Each vestige downside is only applied once while in your inventory. {colour_start|cursed_gem}"Maligned"{colour_end} enemies are guaranteed to drop Vestiges.

TODO:Yngolian drops {colour_start|yngolian1}Celestial{colour_end} trinkets. These special trinkets can be used in place of a standard torch to activate the Yngolian's Beacon, and in doing so will upgrade the trinket! [Remember that evolving trinkets must be placed in the inventory before they can be used on curios.]

TODO:Deception is everywhere!
Cactonids lie in wait to attack unsuspecting adventurers! {colour_start|notable}Most curios in the Treasury are disguised Cactonids ready to strike, but these creatures are overloaded with riches, both exotic and mundane.{colour_end} Certain interactions can be used to give yourself an advantage in fights against these floral beasts, so prepare accordingly.
While there are some roaming creatures which call the Treasury their home, most fights will be ones you initiate.
{colour_start|notable}Choose your fights carefully to bring home as many spoils as you can!{colour_end}
Écoutez attentivement. Ça pourrait vous sauver.
TODO:Short for "accuracy". Base chance to hit is ACC minus the enemy's DODGE.
TODO:A log of major events that occur on the ship each week. Can be accessed while in the Flameseeker.

TODO:A temporary condition that may be triggered when a hero reaches 100 stress. Afflicted heroes act on their own and suffer stat penalties. Afflictions can be cured on the Ship by reducing the hero's stress at the Amber Workshop or the Tavern.
TODO:A type of provision used to remove Blight. Antivenom ignores Blight Cure Received Chance debuffs. It also has uses on many dungeon curios.
TODO:A hero's armor determines their base DODGE and MAX HP. Armor can be upgraded at the Blacksmith.
TODO:A type of provision used to remove Bleed. Bandages ignores Bleed Cure Received Chance debuffs. It also has uses on many dungeon curios.
TODO:Heroes or enemies with Bleed take damage each combat round or hallway step. It will eventually go away but can be cured early with bandages, combat skills, and Camping skills.
TODO:Heroes or enemies with Blight take damage each combat round or hallway step. It will eventually go away but can be cured early with antivenom, combat skills, and Camping skills.
TODO:A relic typically found in the Catacombs. Used to upgrade buildings on the ship.
TODO:An ability used by a hero during Camping.
TODO:An ability used by a hero during combat.

TODO:Most dead monsters leave a temporary corpse. Corpses preserve the enemy order for a time and require heroes to use skills to attack around the corpses, move other enemies in reach, and so on. Alternatively, corpses can be attacked and cleared manually.
TODO:A relic found in Exposed Interior dungeons. Used to upgrade buildings in on the ship.
TODO:Short for "critical hit chance". Critical hits do extra damage and provide stress relief (when a hero crits) or stress damage (when a monster crits).
TODO:A hit taken by a hero on Death's Door that permanently kills the hero.

TODO:Also known as "Mortality". A hero with 0 HP is at Death's Door. Each subsequent hit taken while at Death's Door has a chance of permanently killing the hero. Additionally, each hit taken while on Death's Door will lower the hero's Deathblow Resist for 32 tns
TODO:Bonus towards resisting incoming debuffs and marks.
TODO:A relic typically found in the Caverns. Used to upgrade buildings on the Ship.
TODO:A temporary sickness that debilitates the hero in some way. Disease Kits can tend the disease or revert the disease back into a symptom, but the disease itself can only be cured in the Clinic.
TODO:Short for "damage". Determines how many health points, or HP, are removed from the target if an attack connects.
TODO:Dodge gets removed from the enemy's Accuracy to determine base chance to hit.
TODO:Commonly refers to the weapon and armor equipped to a hero, but can also include Trinkets. Weapons and armor cannot be unequipped but can be upgraded.
TODO:A type of provision used for Camping meals and other meals while wandering. Can be fed individually to a hero for a small boost in HP.
TODO:The basic currency of the Flameseeker. Used to purchase Trinkets, learn and upgrade skills, and upgrade Equipment.
TODO:A heart attack occurs when a hero reaches 200 stress. This will drop a hero to Death's Door, or kill one already there.
TODO:A special currency type that is most often used to upgrade buildings on the Ship. There are four types of Relics: Matakh, Amber, Salvaged Jewelry, and Valor Marks.
TODO:A type of provision used to temporarily increase a hero's resistances. Also can be used on dungeon curios.
TODO:Short for "health points". HP is removed as damage is taken. A hero with 0 HP is at Death's Door.
TODO:A type of provision used to cure a hero's combat debuffs. Also can be used on dungeon curios.
TODO:An effect that moves the target forward or backward in the party lineup.
TODO:Bonus towards resisting enemy moves that cause a position change.
TODO:An object found in dungeons that impedes the party's progress. They can be removed by hand or with a Shovel. Clearing an obstacle by hand inflicts DMG and stress on the entire party.
TODO:A Relic typically found in the Treasury. Used to upgrade buildings on the Ship.
TODO:Short for "protection". Indicates what percentage of incoming damage is mitigated. DoTs (bleed, blight), effects and Expiated ignore PROT.
TODO:An item that can be added to the player's inventory before embarking on a quest.

TODO:A character trait on a hero. Quirks can be beneficial (positive) or hindering (negative). Heroes may start with some quirks but acquire more through adventuring. Specific actions, such as attacking enemies or party members dying to enemies, have a chance to grant the hero specific quirks.
TODO:A stat that influences how likely a hero is to resist a particular status, such as Stun or Bleed.

TODO:The veteran level of a hero. A hero with higher Resolve Level can better resist stress, learn higher level skills and wield higher level equipment. Higher Resolve Level heroes will not waste their time on lower level quests. Low Resolve Level heroes adventuring in higher level dungeons will find it more stressful.
TODO:Earning Resolve XP progresses a hero towards the next Resolve Level. Resolve XP can only be earned by completing quests. Heroes do not earn Resolve XP if they abandon or fail quests.
TODO:The collection of all the player's hired heroes.
TODO:A type of provision. Used to clear obstacles to prevent taking DMG and stress.
TODO:A type of provision used on curios in dungeons.
TODO:Short for "speed". Speed influences the order in which combatants act. Initiative is re-rolled each round per combatant. Base value is 1-12, plus modifiers.
TODO:Accrues as heroes travel through dungeons and engage in combat. When a hero reaches 100 stress, she acquires either an Affliction or a Virtue. At 200 stress, the hero suffers a heart attack.
TODO:An effect that forces the hero or enemy to pass on his/her next turn.
TODO:A type of provision. Used to increase the current torchlight within a dungeon.
TODO:The amount of light in a dungeon. Adventuring in brightness is safer but less rewarding, while adventuring in darknesss is more dangerous but more rewarding. Can be increased by using torches.
TODO:A bonus towards avoiding or disarming traps.
TODO:A temporary condition of increased effectiveness that a hero acquires after passing an Affliction Check. Virtued heroes have buffs and may buff or otherwise increase the power of their allies.
TODO:A type of equipment used by a hero to combat the dangers found in dungeons. A hero's weapon determines their base DMG, CRT and SPD. Weapons can be upgraded at the Blacksmith.
TODO:Made whenever a hero reaches 100 Stress and results in an Affliction or Virtue state.
TODO:Surprised heroes have their order jumbled. Heroes are surprised when Ambushed or randomly at the start of non-scouted enemy combats.
TODO:A hidden log of which Afflictions a particular hero has a tendency to develop.
TODO:An interactive prop found in a dungeon hallway or room.
TODO:Limited number of times that a skill may be used in each combat.
TODO:Monsters with Stealth cannot be hit with direct attacks until Stealth expires or is negated with a hero skill. AOE attacks CAN hit stealthed monsters, though!
TODO:Armor Piercing effects make attacks ignore part of target's PROT, which means the attack damage doesn't get reduced by protection as much.

TODO:Bubblenator is not a word in a dictionary. We just want to check how many people actually read those entries. You can redeem your award by going into trinket menu, pressing enter and typing "Reading Comprehension"
TODO:An indication of a disease that hero will get, if the symptom isn't tended to using Disease Kit nor cured in Clinic.
TODO:A tincture useful in the treatment of Horror (stress DOT)
TODO:Ship upgrades available for the Flameseeker
TODO:Mechanical devices primarily used to construct Side Decks.
TODO:An expensive type of provision used to tend to Symptoms and Diseases, lessening their effects.
TODO:Stat bonus received if both trinkets of that set are equipped at the same time.
TODO:An expensive type of provision used to disarm traps more easily. Used heavily in curio interactions.
TODO:A type of provision used to deal with high PROT enemies more efficiently. Can be used in curio interactions.
TODO:Describes Hero's religiousness. This can affect results of certain combat skills, camping skills, and more.
TODO:First round of the combat, during which attacks can't crit and have lowered accuracy. Some attacks ignore the accuracy penalty, and can have changed effects during it.

TODO:Heroes or enemies with Mark will take additional damage and effects from certain skills. For enemies, Marks will additionally make the enemies target Marked hero more often. It will eventually go away after specific number of rounds, but can be removed early with Cleansing Salts and combat skills.
TODO:A buff hero or enemy get after recovering from stun, which will grant them more resilience against further Stuns, consisting of both short-duration buffs and a smaller, combat-long one.

TODO:An effect that heals the opposing team of the expiated unit upon its next attack. The affected unit also takes damage after their next three attacks. Unholy enemies take 50% more damage, Pagan heroes take 50% damage, Religious heroes receive 100% healing upon activation. Each activation of Expiation's healing reduces its effectiveness for the battle. This effect cannot stack.
TODO:An effect that heals and temporarily boosts target's DMG and CRIT on kill. Lasts till the end of the Battle. This effect cannot stack.
TODO:An effect that debuffs target's DMG when they attack or Damage Received each time they use a friendly skill. Lasts until the end of the Battle. This effect cannot stack.

TODO:Conscripted by the Vizier, the Levantine forces are tasked with the excavation and recovery of Kvarotz relics and technology. They operate as trained soldiers, typically working together and fighting with advanced tactics.
TODO:A collective of zealous crusaders that have come to plunder the valley. They battle with the power of the Light, and are typically more effective against Pagan heroes.
TODO:Remnants of the vast Kvarotz Empire. Their sentinels and enforcers still roam the Valley in the dark, and are extremely dangerous to the bodies and minds of those caught in their wake.
TODO:A matriarchal clan of nomadic warriors who worship Pagan gods and the pursuit of unmatched power. They fight with the utmost brutality and relentless onslaughts.
TODO:An effect that applies Shuffle over specific amount of turns.
TODO:Number of rounds before a skill can be used again. Cooldowns are refreshed on combat end.

TODO:A refined version of Amber. Can be created in the Amber Refinery Activity in the Amber Workshop Facility on the Flameseeker, and occasionally be found as loot. Used to purchase luxury provisions, use the Amber Den Activity, and to buy Contraband Trinkets.

TODO:The devolved creatures deep within the caverns, these insectoid savages practice sinister rituals and feast upon raw amber far below the surface. They wear down their opponents with overwhelming numbers rather than individual strength.

TODO:These eldritch hybrids of flesh and flora have overgrown the Kvarotz treasury. They lie in wait, ready to spring upon victims who unwittingly spring their traps, bombarding their prey with various statuses.
TODO:Highly valuable treasures which apply debuffs to heroes while in the inventory. These debuffs do not stack with multiple of the same vestige.

TODO:Exposed Interior quests which subject heroes and enemies to the "Debilitating Daylight" torch effects, and are always set to 100 torchlight. {colour_start|skill_unselectable}Hero Effects: -8 DODGE, -4 SPD, Can't be Ambushed Monster Effects: -4 DODGE Torch Effects: Buff Hero Party: +5 ACC (1 Battle){colour_end}

TODO:Exposed Interior quests which subject heroes and enemies to the "Mantling Moonlight" torch effects, and are always set to 0 torchlight. {colour_start|skill_unselectable}Hero Effects: +3% CRT, +15% Stress Received Monster Effects: +5% CRT, Certain Enemies start battle with Stealth Torch Effects: Buff Hero: Ignore Stealth (1 tn){colour_end}

TODO:An item which grants 1 Block to its user. Can be purchased from the provision screen with Refined Amber Dust.
TODO:An item which grants temporary buffs and riposte to its user. Produced by the Adrenaline Manufactorum, and obtained from the provision screen.
TODO:An item which cures almost all statuses on its user. Can be purchased from the provision screen with Refined Amber Dust.
TODO:An item which can be obtained from a special trinket. Using it applies PROT and Crit Received debuffs to enemies.
TODO:An item which can be obtained from a special trinket. Using it applies ACC and CRT debuffs to enemies.
TODO:An item which can be obtained from a special trinket. Using it applies status chance debuffs to enemies.
TODO:An item which can be obtained from a special trinket. Using it applies Healing Received and Blight Resistance debuffs to enemies.
